question: Will Liverpool FC win the quadruple this season?
description:
In a football season, clubs typically compete in a number of domestic competitions, such as a league and one or more cup competitions, as well as sometimes in continental competitions. A quadruple in association football is achieved when a club team wins four or more trophies in a single season.

This season (2021-22) English club Liverpool FC has a chance to achieve quadruple - defined for the purpose of this market as winning the following four competitions: English League Cup, FA Cup, Premier League and UEFA Champions League.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Liverpool FC wins all four of these competitions and "No" otherwise.
This market will resolve to "No" as soon as Liverpool drops out of the FA Cup or the UEFA Champions League.

If for whatever reason by June 30, 2022 (11:59:59 PM ET), it is still unknown whether Liverpool FC has won any of the competitions listed above, this market will resolve to "No".

--------------------------------
At this market's inception time (April 18, 2022), Liverpool FC have already won this season's League Cup; are currently second in the Premier League, a point behind champions Man City with just seven games to play; advanced to UEFA Champions League semi-finals (to compete with Villareal CF) and to the FA Cup final (to face Chelsea London). The last possibly decisive game is scheduled for May 28 (UEFA CL final).

question: Will Lost Ark be in the top 2 most played games on Steam on May 11, 2022?
description:
This is a market on whether Lost Ark will be #1 or #2 on Steam in terms of peak players on May 11, 2022 at 11:59:59 PM ET. Results of this market will be decided by the official Steam player count ("Peak Today") available at https://store.steampowered.com/stats/. 

If Lost Ark is #1 or #2 or tied for any of those spots, this market will resolve to "Yes", and otherwise to "No." 

In the event the resolution source is not available on May 11, 2022, at 11:59:59 PM ET, another credible source will be chosen. If no other credible sources are available, the source will be checked every 24 hours until May 18, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, after which the market will resolve 50-50.

The games listed at the resolution source will be ranked from highest to lowest based on the numbers in the "Peak Today" column. In the case of ties, the market will use standard competition ranking ("1224" ranking),  where each game's ranking number is 1 plus the number of games ranked above it.

question: Will the price of Dogecoin (DOGE) be above $0.142069 on May 6, 2022?
description:
This is a market on if the price of Dogecoin ($DOGE) will be above $0.142069 in USD on May 6, 2022 (12 PM ET).

This market will resolve to “Yes” if Dogecoin ($DOGE) has a candlestick closing price greater than $0.142069, as per the resolution source, on May 6, 2022, 12 PM ET, and “No” otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/dogecoin).

This market will resolve according to the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Fri 06 May 2022, 12:00:00”, with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 12:00:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:30:00 AM ET and the closing price for 12:00:00 PM ET.

The check will be performed after the "Fri 06 May 2022, 12:00:00" candle closes.

question: Will TWTR be delisted from the NYSE by July 31?
description:
Twitter, Inc. recently accepted an offer made by Elon Musk to purchase the company. Musk's stated intention is to take Twitter private. If or when this transaction finalizes, Twitter stock will no longer be listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Twitter (TWTR) is delisted from the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) by July 31, 2022, 4 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Announcements that TWTR will be delisted will not suffice; the delisting of TWTR must be in effect by the resolution date.

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from the NYSE (e.g. https://www.nyse.com/quote/XNYS:TWTR/QUOTE, https://twitter.com/NYSE, etc.), however other credible reporting may be used.

events.title: Will TWTR be delisted from the NYSE..?
events.description: This is a market group on when TWTR will be delisted from the NYSE.

question: Will U.S. inflation be more than 0.4% from March to April 2022?
description:
This is a market on a month-to-month inflation, as measured by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (CPI-U), from March to April 2022.

Inflation is measured by a change in Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) on a seasonally adjusted basis, reported by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the index increased by more than 0.4 percent (on a seasonally adjusted basis) from March 2022 to April 2022 and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the BLS April 2022 Consumer Price Index report (https://www.bls.gov/bls/news-release/cpi.htm), currently scheduled to be released on May 11, 2022, at 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data.

 -------------------------

The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services.

Note that the resolution source for this market will be the official monthly BLS CPI news release which reports seasonally-adjusted month-to-month inflation to only one decimal point (e.g. 0.7%, 0.6%, etc). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market (e.g. if seasonally adjusted month-to-month CPI-U is 0.4%, the market will resolve to “No”, if it is 0.5%, this market will resolve to “Yes”).

events.title: What will the U.S. inflation be from March to April 2022?
events.description:
This is a market on a month-to-month inflation, as measured by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (CPI-U), from March to April 2022.

Inflation is measured by a change in Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) on a seasonally adjusted basis, reported by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

question: Will Elon Musk become CEO of Twitter by September 30?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Elon Musk becomes the CEO of Twitter after the date of this market's inception, April 26, 2022 and by September 30, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An announcement that Elon Musk will become CEO on or before September 30 will not be sufficient to resolve this market. Only a confirmation that Elon Musk is CEO of Twitter, by an official press release of the company or a consensus of credible media sources, within the market timeframe will result in this market resolving to "Yes".

This market will resolve according to official press releases from Twitter as well as the information in their 'About' sections: https://investor.twitterinc.com/corporate-governance/board-of-directors/default.aspx, https://about.twitter.com/en/who-we-are/our-company. A consensus of credible media sources will also suffice.

question: Will more than 2.4 million people travel through a TSA checkpoint on any day on or before May 24, 2022?
description:
This is a market on whether more than 2.4 million people will travel through a TSA checkpoint on any single day between April 26, 2022 and May 24, 2022 (inclusive).

The resolution source for this market will be the daily checkpoint throughput as measured by the US Transportation Security Administration (TSA), https://www.tsa.gov/coronavirus/passenger-throughput. Should this URL change or move locations a new URL on the tsa.gov domain will remain valid to resolve this market. 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the TSA reports a daily checkpoint throughput of more than 2,400,000 for any day between April 26, 2022 and May 24, 2022 (inclusive). This market will resolve to “No” otherwise. 

This market will resolve as soon as throughput data becomes available for the date of May 24, 2022, or on any date before that if the target number is reached. If the target number has not been reached and if data is not available for any of the days from April 26, 2022, to May 24, 2022, by June 3, 2022, the market will resolve to 50-50.  Any revisions published to data for dates April 26, 2022, and onward prior to the release of data for May 24, 2022, will be considered.

question: Will the 7-day COVID-19 case average in the USA be above 100,000 again by August 1, 2022?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if the 7-day COVID-19 Case average is above 100,000 in the US for any day ranging from April 26, 2022, to August 1, 2022, inclusive, and “No” otherwise. The resolution source for this market is the CDC: https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#trends_dailycases.

To account for potential data revisions and/or incompleteness: the market will be checked daily at 8 PM ET to see if any day within the aforementioned range has a 7-day COVID-19 case average above 100,000. These daily checks will occur from April 26, 2022, to August 8, 2022 (inclusive). If an average above 100,000 is detected, it will be checked again 7 days later. If it is still above 100,000 at that point, the market will be resolved. If it is 100,000 or below, then the market will not resolve based on that data point.

question: Will Jack Dorsey return as CEO of Twitter by September 30?
description:
As of the time of this market's inception, April 26, 2022, Jack Dorsey is the chief executive officer (CEO) of Block, Inc. - an American financial services and digital payments company. During the years 2006-2008 and 2015-2021 he was the CEO of Twitter, Inc., which he cofounded.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Jack Dorsey becomes the CEO of Twitter after the date of this market's inception, April 26, 2022 and by September 30, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An announcement that Jack Dorsey will become CEO on or before September 30 will not be sufficient to resolve this market. Only confirmation that Jack Dorsey is again CEO of Twitter will result in this market resolving to "Yes".

This market will resolve according to official press releases from Twitter as well as the information in their 'About' sections: https://investor.twitterinc.com/corporate-governance/board-of-directors/default.aspx, https://about.twitter.com/en/who-we-are/our-company. A consensus of credible media sources will also suffice.

question: League of Legends: will T1 (South Korea) win The 2022 Mid-Season Invitational?
description:
The Mid-Season Invitational (MSI) is an annual Riot Games-organized tournament for League of Legends, a multiplayer online battle arena video game. It is the second most important international League of Legends tournament, behind only the World Championship. Eleven teams compete - each of the premier League of Legends leagues has a team representing them. The 2022 Mid-Season Invitational will be held from May 10 to 29, 2022, in Busan, South Korea. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if SK Telecom T1 wins The 2022 MSI tournament and to "No" otherwise. If the winner of the tournament is not known by July 6, 2022 (11:59:59 PM ET), this market will resolve to "No".

This market will resolve according to official information from Riot Games, the tournament's organizer, either from their website (https://lolesports.com/) or Twitter profiles (https://twitter.com/LeagueOfLegends, https://twitter.com/riotgames).

question: Will TWTR be delisted from the NYSE by September 30?
description:
Twitter, Inc. recently accepted an offer made by Elon Musk to purchase the company. Musk's stated intention is to take Twitter private. If or when this transaction finalizes, Twitter stock will no longer be listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Twitter (TWTR) is delisted from the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) by September 30, 2022, 4 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Announcements that TWTR will be delisted will not suffice; the delisting of TWTR must be in effect by the resolution date.

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from the NYSE (e.g. https://www.nyse.com/quote/XNYS:TWTR/QUOTE, https://twitter.com/NYSE, etc.), however other credible reporting may be used.

events.title: Will TWTR be delisted from the NYSE..?
events.description: This is a market group on when TWTR will be delisted from the NYSE.

question: Will the floor price of Bored Apes be above 135 ETH on May 5?
description:
This is a market on whether Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC) will maintain a floor price above 135 ETH on May 5, 2022 (at 12:00 PM ET), according to https://opensea.io/collection/boredapeyachtclub.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if, on the aforementioned check time, there are no Bored Apes listed for sale for 135 ETH or lower on the official Bored Ape Yacht Club collection page on OpenSea. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Only listings that have existed for at least an hour are valid for this market. List time for an NFT can be found under “Trading History” by clicking the “Listing” filter and hovering over the date.

Note that the exact price at the check time will be used. If no floor price is available at the check time, the source will be checked every following hour. For valid listings that are declining price auctions, the price exactly at the check time will be used, NOT the price at the initial listing time.
